summary: The Whole Milk for Healthy Kids Act of 2025 aims to amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act. The bill allows schools participating in the school lunch program to serve whole milk, in addition to other milk options like reduced-fat, low-fat, and fat-free milk. The bill also specifies that milk fat in whole milk is not considered saturated fat for meal compliance purposes and modifies the rules around physician approval by introducing the presence of parent or legal guardian's decision.
